item.title: How-To: Customise your SSH Config
item.description: I am someone who feels more comfortable using the command-line than many GUI set-ups and who is often SSH-ing between servers; many of these servers have lengthy host names and require various different usernames; luckily the SSH developers thought ahead and came up with a way of pre-setting most options per-host. Here’s an example that will configure “server1.example.com” with the user “example” and the port “222”. I’ll set this all up as “ex1”.
